Constructor Detail

AbstractXmlReader

public AbstractXmlReader()
Method Detail

adjustNamespace

protected void adjustNamespace()
                        throws java.io.IOException

getType

public int getType()
returns the event type integer constant assigned to the current XML token. Possible type values are Xml.START_TAG, Xml.END_TAG, Xml.TEXT, Xml.PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION, Xml.COMMENT, Xml.DOCTYPE, and Xml.END_DOCUMENT

getDegenerated

public boolean getDegenerated()

getName

public java.lang.String getName()
returns the (local) tag name of the element if the token type is Xml.START_TAG or XML.END_TAG. For all other types, null is returned

getNamespace

public java.lang.String getNamespace()
returns the namespace of the element if the token type is Xml.START_TAG or XML.END_TAG. For all other types, null is returned.

getText

public java.lang.String getText()
If the event type is TEXT, PROCESSING_INSTRUCTION, or DOCTYPE, the corresponding string is returned. For all othe event types, null is returned.

getPrefixMap

public PrefixMap getPrefixMap()

getAttributeCount

public int getAttributeCount()

getAttribute

public Attribute getAttribute(int i)
In the event type is START_TAG, this method returns the attribute at the given index position. For all other event types, or if the index is out of range, an IndexOutOfBoundsException will be thrown.

getAttribute

public Attribute getAttribute(java.lang.String name)
returns the local attribute with the given name. convenience method for getAttribute (Xml.NO_NAMESPACE, name);

getAttribute

public Attribute getAttribute(java.lang.String namespace,
                              java.lang.String name)
returns the local attribute with the given qualified name. Please use null as placeholder for any namespace or Xml.NO_NAMESPACE for no namespace.

getValue

public java.lang.String getValue(java.lang.String attrName)
Returns the value of the attribute with the given name. Throws an exception if not instanceof StartTag or if not existing. In order to get a null value for not existing attributes, please call getValueDefault (attrName, null) instead.

getValueDefault

public java.lang.String getValueDefault(java.lang.String attrName,
                                        java.lang.String deflt)
Returns the given attribute value, or the given default value if the attribute is not existing.

next

public int next()
         throws java.io.IOException
advances to the next xml token. Returns the token type code
Returns:
the token type code.

skip

public int skip()
         throws java.io.IOException
works like next, but skips over comments, processing instructions, whitespace and the doctype

                    java.lang.String namespace,
                    java.lang.String name)
             throws java.io.IOException
